name: Bruce Foxton
description:
'''Bruce Douglas Foxton''' (born 1 September 1955) is an English singer, songwriter and musician.

Foxton's music career spans more than 40 years. He came to prominence in the late 1970s as bassist and backing vocalist of  [[mod revival]] band [[the Jam]]. He occasionally performed the lead vocals, such as on the songs "Carnaby Street", "[[News of the World (song)|News of the World]]", "[[David Watts (song)|David Watts]]" and "[[Smithers-Jones]]". After the band's break-up, he pursued a brief solo career releasing one [[studio album]], ''[[Touch Sensitive (album)|Touch Sensitive]]'', in 1984. The album's single "[[Freak (Bruce Foxton song)|Freak]]" became a UK Top 20 hit in 1983. He played in several bands, including [[Sharp (English band)|Sharp]] with former Jam member [[Rick Buckler]], before joining [[Stiff Little Fingers]] in 1990. After leaving SLF in 2007, Foxton joined Rick Buckler and members of his tribute band, the Gift, to tour under the name [[From the Jam]] until the end of his guitar playing career in 2025.
